section.title: Evidence Model
section.t: The Proof of Process evidence model defines the structure and semantics of evidence packets collected during content creation. Each packet represents a discrete observation window and contains cryptographically bound behavioral measurements.

section.title: Evidence Packet Structure
section.t: An evidence packet is a CBOR-encoded map containing:

list.t: Monotonically increasing packet number within the session.
SHA-256 hash of the preceding packet, forming the chain.
SHA-256 hash of document state at window close.
Behavioral measurements for the window (cadence, entropy, revision count).
Sequential Work Function output binding the packet to elapsed time.

section.title: Evidence Chain
section.t: An evidence chain is an ordered sequence of evidence packets linked by their prev-hash fields. The chain forms a tamper-evident log: any modification to a packet invalidates all subsequent packets in the chain. The Verifier MUST verify the entire chain from head to tail before producing an Attestation Result.
